channel.title: HOME on Zhizhuo Zhang
channel.description: Recent content in HOME on Zhizhuo Zhang

item.title: Getting started
item.description: Here are some details to help you getting started with this theme.

item.title: Portfolio Definition
item.description: Here are some details about the portfolio settings.

item.title: Knolling bot
item.description: In this study, we proposed the Knolling bot, a Transformer-based approach to organizing a messy table. The results of this project have been submitted to ICRA 2024 for review. Knolling is the process of arranging items neatly in a flat layout. Popular applications range from tools to food and fashion. We draw inspiration from natural language processing (NLP) and utilize a transformer-based approach that predicts the next position of an item in a sequence of neatly positioned items.

item.title: Knolling bot 2
item.description: In this study, we improved the Knolling bot in terms of manipulation, trajectory planning policies, and the strategy of grasping to make the whole system more robust. The result of this project have been accepted by NeurIPS2023 Workshop. (View the article) We can take two steps to finish this task. Grasp Prediction Model There is a correlation between the information of different objects in the same scenario, which determines whether a specific object can be grasped.

item.title: Archetypes management
item.description: The archetypes are defined in the archetypes folder, for both post and portfolio.

item.title: Manage Your Menu
item.description: Menu in the sidebar can be defined within the config.toml or directly in the files. I prefer the config file approach, as this menu is pretty simple.

item.title: Shortcodes
item.description: Introduction of the shortcodes defined in the personal-web theme.

item.title: Config File
item.description:
Here is the basic config file used for personal-web.

You can use it as a base for your website.

item.title: Open Graph image
item.description: Within any page, you can add in the FrontMatter a images array that will be used to define a specific Open Graph image. For example, see content/_index.md page: images: ["/images/sample.jpg"]

item.title: Apple Picking Robotics Arm Control System Based on ROS
item.description: This project aimed to develop a motion planning software package for a six-axis manipulator with the improved Rapidly-Exploring Random Tree (RRT) algorithm as the core, which can theoretically be applicable to almost all six-axis robotic arms. The results of this project have been accepted by Sensors. The Strategy of Parent Point Priority Determination (PPD) Based on the regular RRT algorithm, we improved it based on the Parent Point Priority Determination (PPD), to save time in traversing the whole random tree in the process of determining the parent point.

item.title: Evolving Soft Robots
item.description: This project aims to evolve a soft robot with variable morphology and select the individual with the highest speed in a customized physical simulator by using an evolutionary algorithm. Develop a 3D Physics Simulator In general, the robot in a physical simulator can be defined as several masses and springs connected between each mass. Different physical parameters of each spring and each mass can affect the shape and movement of the robot.

item.title: Robotic Pick and Place Task Based on Visual Affordance Model
item.description: In this project, I implemented the pick and place tasks in an environment with multiple objects. The robot arm can recognize objects it wants to grasp in a messy environment and try to grasp them with appropriate postures. After that, the robot arm can avoid obstacles while moving and place objects inside the box. The whole task can be divided into several steps: Human Demonstration Considering this task only includes top-down grasping, where the pose of the gripper is reduced to three degrees of freedom (2D translation and 1D rotation), the transnational degrees of freedom are naturally encoded in the 2D pixel coordinates.
